name: col
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the lowest point of a high edge between two mountains, usually where you can pass between them: From the col there is a wonderful view back down over the ski village.
More examplesFewer examplesThe great cols are ways of getting through the mountains.The riders of the Tour de France will climb through the Vosges mountains, each of the cols harder than the one before. This is the col between Tryfan and Glyder Fach, from where the South Ridge of Tryfan leads to the summit.Finally we crest a col and the hut looms into view.

written abbreviation for column: a vertical row of words or numbers: See the Evening Advertiser, page 2, col. 1. The table shows graduate employment alongside the average UCAS points of students (col. 2).
